trans-unit.source: The <nav> represents a section of a page whose purpose is to provide navigation links, either within the current document or to other documents. Common examples of navigation sections are menus, tables of contents, and indexes.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <nav> 表示，其目的是提供导航链接的页面的部分，无论是在当前文档中或其他文档。导航部分的常见示例是菜单，目录和索引。

trans-unit.source: The <noscript> defines a section of HTML to be inserted if a script type on the page is unsupported or if scripting is currently turned off in the browser.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <noscript> 定义，如果页面上的脚本类型不受支持或者如果脚本在浏览器当前处于关闭状态被插入HTML的部分。

trans-unit.source: The <object> represents an external resource, which can be treated as an image, a nested browsing context, or a resource to be handled by a plugin.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <object> 表示外部资源，其可以被视为图像，嵌套浏览上下文，或资源由一个插件来处理。

trans-unit.source: The <ol> and <ul> elements both represent a list of items. The difference is with the <ol> element, the order is meaningful. For example:
The <ol> and <ul> elements may nest as deeply as desired, alternating between <ol> and <ul> however you like.
The <ol> represents an ordered list of items — typically rendered as a numbered list.
The <ol> represents an ordered list of items, typically rendered as a numbered list.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <ol> 表示的物品，典型地呈现为编号列表的有序列表。

trans-unit.source: The <optgroup> creates a grouping of options within a <select> element.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <optgroup> 创建一个内的分组的选项 <select> 元素。

trans-unit.source: The <optgroup> creates a grouping of options within a <select> element.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <optgroup> 创建一个内的分组的选项 <select> 元素。

trans-unit.source: The <option> is used to define an item contained in a <select>, an <optgroup>, or a <datalist> element. As such, <option> can represent menu items in popups and other lists of items in an HTML document.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <option> 用于定义包含在一个项目 <select> ，一个 <optgroup> 或 <datalist> 元素。这样， <option> 可以表示弹出菜单中的菜单项以及HTML文档中的其他项列表。

trans-unit.source: The <option> is used to define an item contained in a <select>, an <optgroup>, or a <datalist> element. As such, <option> can represent menu items in popups and other lists of items in an HTML document.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <option> 用于定义包含在一个项目 <select> ，一个 <optgroup> 或 <datalist> 元素。这样， <option> 可以表示弹出菜单中的菜单项以及HTML文档中的其他项列表。

trans-unit.source: The <output> value, name, and contents are NOT submitted during form submission.
The <p> represents a paragraph.
trans-unit.target: 的 <p> 表示一个段落。

trans-unit.source: The <p> represents a paragraph. Paragraphs are usually represented in visual media as blocks of text separated from adjacent blocks by blank lines and/or first-line indentation, but HTML paragraphs can be any structural grouping of related content, such as images or form fields.
trans-unit.target: 的 <p> 表示一个段落。段落通常在视觉媒体中表示为由空白行和/或第一行缩进与相邻块分隔的文本块，但是HTML段落可以是相关内容的任何结构分组，例如图像或表单字段。

trans-unit.source: The <param> defines parameters for an <object> element.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <param> 定义的参数的 <object> 元素。

trans-unit.source: The <param> defines parameters for an <object> element.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <param> 定义的参数的 <object> 元素。

trans-unit.source: The <picture> contains zero or more <source> elements and one <img> element to offer alternative versions of an image for different display/device scenarios.
The <picture> contains zero or more <source> elements and one <img> element to provide versions of an image for different display/device scenarios.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <picture> 包含零个或多个 <source> 元件和一个 <img> 元件，以提供不同的显示/设备场景的图像的版本。

trans-unit.source: The <picture> contains zero or more <source> elements and one <img> element to offer alternative versions of an image for different display/device scenarios.

The <picture> contains zero or more <source> elements and one <img> element to provide versions of an image for different display/device scenarios. The browser will consider each child <source> element and chooses the best match among them; if no matches are found, the URL of the <img> element's src attribute is selected. The selected image is then presented in the space occupied by the <img> element.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <picture> 包含零个或多个 <source> 元件和一个 <img> 元件，以提供不同的显示/设备场景的图像的版本。浏览器将考虑每个子元素 <source> 并在其中选择最佳匹配；如果找不到匹配项，则选择 <img> 元素的 src 属性的URL 。然后，所选图像将显示在 <img> 元素占据的空间中。

trans-unit.source: The <pre> represents preformatted text which is to be presented exactly as written in the HTML file.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <pre> 表示预格式文本将被精确地呈现为写在HTML文件。

trans-unit.source: The <pre> represents preformatted text which is to be presented exactly as written in the HTML file. The text is typically rendered using a non-proportional ("monospace") font. Whitespace inside this element is displayed as written.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <pre> 表示预格式文本将被精确地呈现为写在HTML文件。通常使用非比例（“ 等宽字体”）字体呈现文本。此元素内的空白显示为书面形式。

trans-unit.source: The <progress> displays an indicator showing the completion progress of a task, typically displayed as a progress bar.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <progress> 显示表示任务的完成进度的指示符，典型地显示为进度条。

trans-unit.source: The <q> indicates that the enclosed text is a short inline quotation. Most modern browsers implement this by surrounding the text in quotation marks.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <q> 表示中间的文本是一个短的内联的报价。大多数现代浏览器通过将文本用引号引起来来实现此目的。

trans-unit.source: The <q> indicates that the enclosed text is a short inline quotation. Most modern browsers implement this by surrounding the text in quotation marks. This element is intended for short quotations that don't require paragraph breaks; for long quotations use the <blockquote> element.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <q> 表示中间的文本是一个短的内联的报价。大多数现代浏览器通过将文本用引号引起来来实现此目的。此元素用于不需要段落分隔符的短引号；对于长报价，请使用 <blockquote> 元素。

trans-unit.source: The <rb> is used to delimit the base text component of a <ruby> annotation, i.e. the text that is being annotated.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <rb> 用于分隔的基部文本成分的 <ruby> 注释，即正被注释的文本。

trans-unit.source: The <rb> is used to delimit the base text component of a <ruby> annotation, i.e. the text that is being annotated. One <rb> element should wrap each separate atomic segment of the base text.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <rb> 用于分隔的基部文本成分的 <ruby> 注释，即正被注释的文本。一个 <rb> 元素应包裹基础文本的每个单独的原子段。

trans-unit.source: The <rp> is used to provide fall-back parentheses for browsers that do not support display of ruby annotations using the <ruby> element.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <rp> 用于为不支持使用红宝石注释的显示的浏览器提供回退括号 <ruby> 元素。

trans-unit.source: The <rp> is used to provide fall-back parentheses for browsers that do not support display of ruby annotations using the <ruby> element. One <rp> element should enclose each of the opening and closing parentheses that wrap the <rt> element that contains the annotation's text.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <rp> 用于为不支持使用红宝石注释的显示的浏览器提供回退括号 <ruby> 元素。一个 <rp> 元素应括起每个括起包含注释文本的 <rt> 元素的右括号和右括号。

trans-unit.source: The <rt> specifies the ruby text component of a ruby annotation, which is used to provide pronunciation, translation, or transliteration information for East Asian typography. The <rt> element must always be contained within a <ruby> element.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <rt> 指定一个红宝石注释，其被用于为东亚版式提供发音，翻译或音译信息的红宝石文本成分。所述 <rt> 元素必须始终包含在一个内 <ruby> 元素。

trans-unit.source: The <rt> specifies the ruby text component of a ruby annotation, which is used to provide pronunciation, translation, or transliteration information for East Asian typography. The <rt> element must always be contained within a <ruby> element.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <rt> 指定一个红宝石注释，其被用于为东亚版式提供发音，翻译或音译信息的红宝石文本成分。所述 <rt> 元素必须始终包含在一个内 <ruby> 元素。

trans-unit.source: The <rtc> embraces semantic annotations of characters presented in a ruby of <rb> elements used inside of <ruby> element. <rb> elements can have both pronunciation (<rt>) and semantic (<rtc>) annotations.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <rtc> 涵盖在红宝石呈现字符的语义注释 <rb> 内部使用的元素 <ruby> 元素。 <rb> 元素可以同时具有发音（ <rt> ）和语义（ <rtc> ）批注。

trans-unit.source: The <rtc> embraces semantic annotations of characters presented in a ruby of <rb> elements used inside of <ruby> element. <rb> elements can have both pronunciation (<rt>) and semantic (<rtc>) annotations.

The <rtc> embraces semantic annotations of characters presented in a ruby of <rb> elements used inside of <ruby> element. <rb> elements can have both pronunciation (<rt>) and semantic (<rtc>) annotations.

The <rtc> embraces semantic annotations of characters presented in a ruby of <rb> elements used inside of <ruby> element. <rb> elements can have both pronunciation (<rt>) and semantic (<rtc>) annotations.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <rtc> 涵盖在红宝石呈现字符的语义注释 <rb> 内部使用的元素 <ruby> 元素。 <rb> 元素可以同时具有发音（ <rt> ）和语义（ <rtc> ）批注。

trans-unit.source: The <ruby> represents a ruby annotation. Ruby annotations are for showing pronunciation of East Asian characters.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <ruby> 表示红宝石注释。Ruby注释用于显示东亚字符的发音。

trans-unit.source: The <ruby> represents small annotations that are rendered above, below, or next to base text, usually used for showing the pronunciation of East Asian characters. It can also be used for annotating other kinds of text, but this usage is less common.

The <s> renders text with a strikethrough, or a line through it. Use the <s> element to represent things that are no longer relevant or no longer accurate. However, <s> is not appropriate when indicating document edits; for that, use the <del> and <ins> elements, as appropriate.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <s> 呈现带有删除线，或通过它的文本行。使用 <s> 元素表示不再相关或不再准确的事物。但是， <s> 在指示文档编辑时不合适；为此，请根据需要使用 <del> 和 <ins> 元素。

trans-unit.source: The <s> renders text with a strikethrough, or a line through it. Use the <s> element to represent things that are no longer relevant or no longer accurate. However, <s> is not appropriate when indicating document edits; for that, use the <del> and <ins> elements, as appropriate.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <s> 呈现带有删除线，或通过它的文本行。使用 <s> 元素表示不再相关或不再准确的事物。但是， <s> 在指示文档编辑时不合适；为此，请根据需要使用 <del> 和 <ins> 元素。

trans-unit.source: The <script> is used to embed executable code or data; this is typically used to embed or refer to JavaScript code.

The <script> is used to embed executable code or data; this is typically used to embed or refer to JavaScript code. The <script> element can also be used with other languages, such as WebGL's GLSL shader programming language and JSON.
The <script> is used to embed or reference executable code; this is typically used to embed or refer to JavaScript code.
trans-unit.target: 该 <script> 用于嵌入或参考的可执行代码; 通常用于嵌入或引用JavaScript代码。

trans-unit.source: The <script> is used to embed or reference executable code; this is typically used to embed or refer to JavaScript code. The <script> element can also be used with other languages, such as WebGL's GLSL shader programming language.
trans-unit.target: 该 <script> 用于嵌入或参考的可执行代码; 通常用于嵌入或引用JavaScript代码。该 <script> 元件也可以与其他语言，例如用于的WebGL的 GLSL着色器编程语言。

trans-unit.source: The <section> represents a standalone section — which doesn't have a more specific semantic element to represent it — contained within an HTML document.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <section> 表示一个独立的部分-其不具有其代表一个更具体的语义单元-包含在HTML文档中。

trans-unit.source: The <section> represents a standalone section — which doesn't have a more specific semantic element to represent it — contained within an HTML document. Typically, but not always, sections have a heading.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <section> 表示一个独立的部分-其不具有其代表一个更具体的语义单元-包含在HTML文档中。通常，但并非总是如此，各节都有标题。

trans-unit.source: The <select> element has some unique attributes you can use to control it, such as multiple to specify whether multiple options can be selected, and size to specify how many options should be shown at once. It also accepts most of the general form input attributes such as required, disabled, autofocus, etc.

The <select> element has some unique attributes you can use to control it, such as multiple to specify whether multiple options can be selected, and size to specify how many options should be shown at one. It also accepts most of the general form input attributes such as required, disabled, autofocus, etc.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <select> 元件具有可以用来控制它，比如一些独特的属性 multiple 可指定多个选项是否可以选择和大小指定多少选项应该在一个被显示。它还接受大多数常规形式的输入属性，例如 required ， disabled ， autofocus 等。

trans-unit.source: The <select> element is notoriously difficult to style productively with CSS. You can affect certain aspects like any element — for example, manipulating the box model, the displayed font, etc., and you can use the appearance property to remove the default system appearance.
trans-unit.target: 众所周知， <select> 元素很难用CSS有效地设置样式。您可以影响某些方面，例如任何元素，例如，操纵盒子模型，显示的字体等，并且您可以使用 appearance 属性删除默认的系统 appearance 。

trans-unit.source: The <select> for choosing the month is hardcoded with the names of the months, as they don't change (leaving localization out of things). The list of available year values is dynamically generated depending on the current year (see the code comments below for detailed explanations of how these functions work).
trans-unit.target: 用于选择月份的 <select> 与月份的名称进行硬编码，因为它们不变（保留了本地化内容）。可用年份值列表是根据当前年份动态生成的（有关这些功能如何工作的详细说明，请参见下面的代码注释）。

trans-unit.source: The <select> represents a control that provides a menu of options
trans-unit.target: 所述 <select> 表示，其提供选项菜单的控制

trans-unit.source: The <select> represents a control that provides a menu of options:
trans-unit.target: 所述 <select> 表示，其提供选项菜单的控制：

trans-unit.source: The <shadow>—an obsolete part of the Web Components technology suite—was intended to be used as a shadow DOM insertion point.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <shadow> >所述的-an过时部分Web组件技术套件-旨在被用作阴影DOM 插入点。

trans-unit.source: The <slot>—part of the Web Components technology suite—is a placeholder inside a web component that you can fill with your own markup, which lets you create separate DOM trees and present them together.
trans-unit.target: 该 <slot> 的双组分的Web组件技术套件，是一个Web组件中的占位符，你可以用自己的标记，它可以让你创建单独的DOM树，同时，陈述他们填写。

trans-unit.source: The <small>element makes the text font size one size smaller (for example, from large to medium, or from small to x-small) down to the browser's minimum font size. In HTML5, this element is repurposed to represent side-comments and small print, including copyright and legal text, independent of its styled presentation.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <small> 元件使文本的字体大小一个尺寸小（例如，从大到中，或从小到的x小）降低到浏览器的最小字体大小。在HTML5中，此元素的用途重新定义为代表旁注和小字体，包括版权和法律文本，而与样式表示方式无关。

trans-unit.source: The <small>element represents side-comments and small print, like copyright and legal text, independent of its styled presentation. By default, it renders text within it one font-size smaller, such as from small to x-small.
The <source> element is an empty element (or void element), which means that it not only has no content but also has no closing tag. That is, you never use "</source>" in your HTML.
The <source> specifies multiple media resources for the <picture>, the <audio> element, or the <video> element.

The <source> specifies multiple media resources for the <picture>, the <audio> element, or the <video> element. It is an empty element. It is commonly used to serve the same media content in multiple formats supported by different browsers.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <source> 指定所述多个媒体资源 <picture> 中， <audio> 元素，或 <video> 元素。它是一个空元素。它通常用于提供不同浏览器支持的多种格式的相同媒体内容。

trans-unit.source: The <source> specifies multiple media resources for the <picture>, the <audio> element, or the <video> element. It is an empty element, meaning that it has no content and does not have a closing tag. It is commonly used to offer the same media content in multiple file formats in order to provide compatibility with a broad range of browsers given their differing support for image file formats and media file formats.

The <source> specifies multiple media resources for the <picture>, the <audio> element, or the <video> element. It is an empty element. It is commonly used to serve the same media content in multiple formats supported by different browsers.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <source> 指定所述多个媒体资源 <picture> 中， <audio> 元素，或 <video> 元素。它是一个空元素。它通常用于提供不同浏览器支持的多种格式的相同媒体内容。

trans-unit.source: The <span> is a generic inline container for phrasing content, which does not inherently represent anything. It can be used to group elements for styling purposes (using the class or id attributes), or because they share attribute values, such as lang. It should be used only when no other semantic element is appropriate. <span> is very much like a <div> element, but <div> is a block-level element whereas a <span> is an inline element.

The <span> is a generic inline container for phrasing content, which does not inherently represent anything. It can be used to group elements for styling purposes (using the class or id attributes), or because they share attribute values, such as lang.

The <span> is a generic inline container for phrasing content, which does not inherently represent anything. It can be used to group elements for styling purposes (using the class or id attributes), or because they share attribute values, such as lang.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <span> 为措辞内容，这本身不表示任何一个通用的在线容器。它可以用于对元素进行分组以进行样式设置（使用 class 或 id 属性），或者因为它们共享属性值（例如 lang )。

trans-unit.source: The <span> is a generic inline container for phrasing content, which does not inherently represent anything. It can be used to group elements for styling purposes (using the class or id attributes), or because they share attribute values, such as lang. It should be used only when no other semantic element is appropriate. <span> is very much like a <div> element, but <div> is a block-level element whereas a <span> is an inline element.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <span> 为措辞内容，这本身不表示任何一个通用的在线容器。它可以用于对元素进行分组以进行样式设置（使用 class 或 id 属性），或者因为它们共享属性值（例如 lang )。仅当没有其他语义元素合适时才应使用它。 <span> 非常类似于 <div> 元素，但是 <div> 是块级元素，而 <span> 是内联元素。

trans-unit.source: The <strike> (or HTML Strikethrough Element) places a strikethrough (horizontal line) over text.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <strike> （或HTML删除线元件）放置在文本删除线（水平线）。

trans-unit.source: The <strong> element is for content that is of "strong importance," including things of great seriousness or urgency (such as warnings). This could be a sentence that is of great importance to the whole page, or you could merely try to point out that some words are of greater importance compared to nearby content.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <strong> 元素为是“强重要性”，包括大严重性或紧急的事情（例如，警告）的内容。这可能是一个对整个页面都非常重要的句子，或者您只能尝试指出某些单词比附近的内容更重要。

trans-unit.source: The <style> contains style information for a document, or part of a document.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <style> 包含用于文档的文档，或者部分的样式信息。

trans-unit.source: The <style> contains style information for a document, or part of a document. It contains CSS, which is applied to the contents of the document containing the <style> element.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <style> 包含用于文档的文档，或者部分的样式信息。它包含CSS，该CSS应用于包含 <style> 元素的文档的内容。

trans-unit.source: The <style> element can be included inside the <head> or <body> of the document, and the styles will still be applied, however it is recommended that you include your styles in the <head> for organizational purposes — it is a lot better to separate your content from your presentation as much as possible. Even better, put your styles in external stylesheets and apply them using <link> elements.
trans-unit.target: 可以将 <style> 元素包含在文档的 <head> 或 <body> 内，并且仍将应用样式，但是出于组织目的，建议您将样式包含在 <head> 中。最好将您的内容与演示文稿尽可能地分开。更好的是，将样式放在外部样式表中，并使用 <link> 元素应用它们。

trans-unit.source: The <style> element itself has no visual representation, therefore it has no styling considerations.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <style> 元件本身不具有可视表示，因此它没有造型考虑。

trans-unit.source: The <style> element must be included inside the <head> of the document. In general, it is better to put your styles in external stylesheets and apply them using <link> elements.

The <sub> element should be used only for typographical reasons—that is, to change the position of the text to comply with typographical conventions or standards, rather than solely for presentation or appearance purposes.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <sub> 元素应该被只用于印刷的原因，也就是说，改变文本的位置以符合印刷惯例或标准，而不是仅仅用于呈现或外观的目的。

trans-unit.source: The <summary> element's contents can be any heading content, plain text, or HTML that can be used within a paragraph.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <summary> 元素的内容可以是任何内容的标题，纯文本，HTML或可段落内使用。

trans-unit.source: The <sup> element should only be used for typographical reasons—that is, to change the position of the text to comply with typographical conventions or standards, rather than solely for presentation or appearance purposes.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <sup> 元素应该仅被用于印刷的原因，也就是说，改变文本的位置以符合印刷惯例或标准，而不是仅仅用于呈现或外观的目的。

trans-unit.source: The <table> represents tabular data — that is, information presented in a two-dimensional table comprised of rows and columns of cells containing data.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <table> 表示表格数据-即，在信息由含有数据单元的行和列的两维表中。

trans-unit.source: The <tbody> element is not a required child element for a parent <table> element to graphically render. However, it must not be present, if its parent <table> element has a <tr> element as a child.

The <tbody> element, along with its cousins <thead> and <tfoot>, provide useful semantic information that can be used when rendering for either screen or printer as well as for accessibility purposes.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <tbody> 元件，以其沿着表亲 <thead> 和 <tfoot> ，提供一种能够渲染任一屏幕或打印机，以及用于当被用于有用的语义信息可访问性的目的。

trans-unit.source: The <td> defines a cell of a table that contains data. It participates in the table model.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <td> 定义了包含数据的表的一个单元格。它参与表模型。

trans-unit.source: The <template> is a mechanism for holding HTML that is not to be rendered immediately when a page is loaded but may be instantiated subsequently during runtime using JavaScript.
The <template> is a mechanism for holding client-side content that is not to be rendered when a page is loaded but may subsequently be instantiated during runtime using JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <template> 是用于保持被加载时，一个页不被渲染，但随后可在运行时期间使用JavaScript来实例化的客户端内容的机制。

trans-unit.source: The <textarea> element also accepts several attributes common to form <input>s, such as autocomplete, autofocus, disabled, placeholder, readonly, and required.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <textarea> 的元件也接受几个属性共用的形式 <input> S，如 autocomplete ， autofocus ， disabled ， placeholder ， readonly ，和 required 。

trans-unit.source: The <textarea> represents a multi-line plain-text editing control, useful when you want to allow users to enter a sizeable amount of free-form text, for example a comment on a review or feedback form.
trans-unit.target: 在 <textarea> 的代表多行纯文本编辑器，有用的，当你想允许用户输入自由格式的文本的一个相当大的量，例如审查或反馈表的注释。

trans-unit.source: The <tfoot> defines a set of rows summarizing the columns of the table.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <tfoot> 定义了一组行总结的表的列。

trans-unit.source: The <th> defines a cell as header of a group of table cells. The exact nature of this group is defined by the scope and headers attributes.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <th> 定义了一个小区作为一组表格单元中的报头。该组的确切性质由 scope 和 headers 属性定义。

trans-unit.source: The <th> defines a cell as header of a group of table cells. The exact nature of this group is defined by the scope and headers attributes.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <th> 定义了一个小区作为一组表格单元中的报头。该组的确切性质由 scope 和 headers 属性定义。

trans-unit.source: The <thead> defines a set of rows defining the head of the columns of the table.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <thead> 定义了一组定义所述表的列的头行。

trans-unit.source: The <time> represents a specific period in time. It may include the datetime attribute to translate dates into machine-readable format, allowing for better search engine results or custom features such as reminders.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <time> 表示一个特定的时间周期。它可能包含datetime属性，以将日期转换成机器可读的格式，从而获得更好的搜索引擎结果或自定义功能（例如提醒）。

trans-unit.source: The <title> element is always used within a page's <head> block.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <title> 单元总是被一页面的内使用 <head> 块。

trans-unit.source: The <tr> defines a row of cells in a table. The row's cells can then be established using a mix of <td> (data cell) and <th> (header cell) elements.

The <tr> defines a row of cells in a table. The row's cells can then be established using a mix of <td> (data cell) and <th> (header cell) elements.The HTML <tr> element specifies that the markup contained inside the <tr> block comprises one row of a table, inside which the <th> and <td> elements create header and data cells, respectively, within the row.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <tr> 细胞中的表定义了一个行。然后可以使用 <td> （数据单元）和 <th> （头单元）元素的混合来建立行的单元格。HTML <tr> 元素指定 <tr> 块内包含的标记包括一行的表，其中的 <th> 和 <td> 元素分别在行内创建标头和数据单元。

trans-unit.source: The <tr> defines a row of cells in a table. The row's cells can then be established using a mix of <td> (data cell) and <th> (header cell) elements.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <tr> 细胞中的表定义了一个行。然后可以使用 <td> （数据单元）和 <th> （头单元）元素的混合来建立行的单元格。

trans-unit.source: The <track> is used as a child of the media elements <audio> and <video>. It lets you specify timed text tracks (or time-based data), for example to automatically handle subtitles. The tracks are formatted in WebVTT format (.vtt files) — Web Video Text Tracks or Timed Text Markup Language (TTML).
trans-unit.target: 所述 <track> 被用作媒体元素的子 <audio> 和 <video> 。它使您可以指定定时的文本轨道（或基于时间的数据），例如以自动处理字幕。轨道以WebVTT格式（ .vtt 文件）格式化-Web视频文本轨道或定时文本标记语言（TTML）。

trans-unit.source: The <track> is used as a child of the media elements <audio> and <video>. It lets you specify timed text tracks (or time-based data), for example to automatically handle subtitles. The tracks are formatted in WebVTT format (.vtt files) — Web Video Text Tracks or Timed Text Markup Language (TTML).
trans-unit.target: 所述 <track> 被用作媒体元素的子 <audio> 和 <video> 。它使您可以指定定时的文本轨道（或基于时间的数据），例如以自动处理字幕。轨道以WebVTT格式（ .vtt 文件）格式化-Web视频文本轨道或定时文本标记语言（TTML）。

trans-unit.source: The <track> is used as a child of the media elements, <audio> and <video>. It lets you specify timed text tracks (or time-based data), for example to automatically handle subtitles. The tracks are formatted in WebVTT format (.vtt files) — Web Video Text Tracks.
The <track> is used as a child of the media elements, <audio> and <video>. It lets you specify timed text tracks (or time-based data), for example to automatically handle subtitles.

The <tt> element is, by default, rendered using the browser's default non-proportional font. You can override this using CSS by creating a rule using the tt selector, as seen in the example Overriding the default font above.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <tt> 元素，默认情况下，使用所述浏览器的默认非比例字体呈现。您可以通过使用 tt 选择器创建规则来使用CSS覆盖此设置，如上面的覆盖默认字体的示例所示。

trans-unit.source: The <ul> and <ol> elements may be nested as deeply as desired. Moreover, the nested lists may alternate between <ol> and <ul> without restriction.

The <ul> element is for grouping a collection of items that do not have a numerical ordering, and their order in the list is meaningless. Typically, unordered-list items are displayed with a bullet, which can be of several forms, like a dot, a circle or a squared. The bullet style is not defined in the HTML description of the page, but in its associated CSS, using the list-style-type property.
trans-unit.target: 在 <ul> 元素是分组没有数字排序的项目的集合，它们在列表中的顺序是没有意义的。通常，无序列表项目以项目符号显示，项目符号可以采用多种形式，例如点，圆形或正方形。项目符号样式不是在页面的HTML描述中定义的，而是在其关联的CSS中使用 list-style-type 属性定义的。

trans-unit.source: The <ul> element is for grouping a collection of items that do not have a numerical ordering, and their order in the list is meaningless. Typically, unordered-list items are displayed with a bullet, which can be of several forms, like a dot, a circle, or a square. The bullet style is not defined in the HTML description of the page, but in its associated CSS, using the list-style-type property.
The <ul> represents an unordered list of items, typically rendered as a bulleted list.
The <video> element is a replaced element — its display value is inline by default, but its default width and height in the viewport is defined by the video being embedded.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <video> 元素是一个替换元件-其 display 值是 inline 默认，但在视口中其默认的宽度和高度由视频嵌入限定。

trans-unit.source: The <wbr> represents a word break opportunity—a position within text where the browser may optionally break a line, though its line-breaking rules would not otherwise create a break at that location.
trans-unit.target: 该 <wbr> 代表一个字破门良机，在文本中位置的浏览器可以选择断行，但其行规则本来不会创建在该位置休息。

trans-unit.source: The * may be replaced by any name following the production rule of XML names with the following restrictions:
The * may be replaced by any name following the production rule of xml names with the following restrictions:

trans-unit.source: The -map arguments correspond to the input files in the sequence they are given; you should have one for each file. The -adaptation_sets argument assigns them into adaptation sets; for example, this creates one set (0) that contains the streams 0, 1, 2 and 3 (the videos), and another set (1) that contains only stream 4, the audio stream.
trans-unit.target: 该 -map 参数对应于他们所给的顺序输入文件; 每个文件应该有一个。该 -adaptation_sets 参数赋值到自适应集; 例如，这将创建一个包含流0、1、2和3（视频）的集合（0），以及另一个仅包含流4，音频流的集合（1）。

trans-unit.source: The .boxLeft class—which, cleverly, is used to style the box on the left—floats the box to the left, then sets up the colors:
trans-unit.target: 该 .boxLeft 类，其中，巧妙地，是用来风格箱在左浮框左侧，然后设置颜色：

trans-unit.source: The .wrapper class is used to assign styles to the <div> that encloses all of our other content. This establishes the size of the container using width and height as well as its margin and padding.
The .wrapper class is used to assign styles to the <div> that encloses all of our other content. This establishes thesize of the container using width and height as well as its margin and padding.
trans-unit.target: 该 .wrapper 类用于指定样式的 <div> 的包围我们所有的其他内容的。这将使用 width 和 height 以及其 margin 和 padding 来确定容器的大小。

trans-unit.source: The id of a <menu> to use as the contextual menu for this element.
trans-unit.target: <menu> 的 id ，用作此元素的上下文菜单。

trans-unit.source: The id of a labelable form-related element in the same document as the <label> element. The first element in the document with an id matching the value of the for attribute is the labeled control for this label element if it is a labelable element. If it is not labelable then the for attribute has no effect. If there are other elements that also match the id value, later in the document, they are not considered.

The id of a labelable form-related element in the same document as the <label> element. The first such element in the document with an id matching the value of the for attribute is the labeled control for this label element.
trans-unit.target: 的 id 一的贴标签的同一文档中的形式相关的元件 <label> 元素。id中与 for 属性的值匹配的id中的第一个此类元素是此label元素的带标签的控件。

trans-unit.source: The title attribute is not an acceptable substitute for the alt attribute. Additionally, avoid duplicating the alt attribute's value in a title attribute declared on the same image. Doing so may cause some screen readers to announce the description twice, creating a confusing experience.

The alt attribute provides alt text for the image, so screen reader users can get a better idea of what the button is used for. It will also display if the image can't be shown for any reason (for example if the path is misspelled). If possible, use text which matches the label you'd use if you were using a standard submit button.
trans-unit.target: 该 alt 属性为图像替代文本，因此屏幕阅读器的用户可以得到什么样的按钮用于更好的主意。如果由于任何原因而无法显示图像（例如，路径拼写错误），它也会显示。如果可能，请使用与您使用标准提交按钮时使用的标签相匹配的文本。

trans-unit.source: The inputmode is set to "numeric" to encourage devices with virtual keyboards to switch to a numeric keypad layout for easier entry. The minlength and maxlength attributes are set to 9 and 12, respectively, to require that the value be at least nine and no more than 12 characters (the former without separating characters between the groups of digits and the latter with them). The required attribute is used to indicate that this control must have a value. Finally, autocomplete is set to "off" to avoid password managers and session restore features trying to set its value, since this isn't a password at all.
trans-unit.target: 该 inputmode 被设置为 "numeric" ，以鼓励与虚拟键盘的设备切换到数字键盘的布局更容易进入。的 minlength 和 maxlength 属性被设置为9和12，分别为要求该值至少为9，并且不超过12个字符（前者没有数字的基团和与它们后者之间分离字符）。将 required 属性被用于表示这种控制必须有一个值。最后，将 autocomplete 功能设置为 "off" 以避免密码管理器和会话还原功能尝试设置其值，因为这根本不是密码。

trans-unit.source: The inputmode is set to numeric to encourage devices with virtual keyboards to switch to a numeric keypad layout for easier entry. The minlength and maxlength attributes are set to 9 and 12, respectively, to require that the value be at least nine and no more than 12 characters (the former without separating characters between the groups of digits and the latter with them). The required attribute is used to indicate that this control must have a value. Finally, autocomplete is set to off to avoid password managers and session restore features trying to set its value, since this isn't a password at all.
The src attribute is used to specify the path to the image you want to display in the button.
trans-unit.target: 在 src 属性用于指定路径要在按钮来显示图像。

trans-unit.source: The value attribute contains a DOMString representing the value contained in the search field. You can retrieve this using the HTMLInputElement.value property in JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: 该 value 属性包含一个 DOMString 表示包含在搜索字段中的值。您可以使用JavaScript中的 HTMLInputElement.value 属性来检索此内容。

trans-unit.source: The value attribute contains a DOMString which contains a string representation of the selected number. The value is never an empty string (""). The default value is halfway between the specified minimum and maximum—unless the maximum is actually less than the minimum, in which case the default is set to the value of the min attribute. The algorithm for determining the default value is:
trans-unit.target: 所述 value 属性包含一个 DOMString 其中包含选定数目的字符串表示。该值绝不能为空字符串（ "" ）。默认值介于指定的最小值和最大值之间，除非最大值实际上小于最小值，在这种情况下，默认值设置为 min 属性的值。确定默认值的算法是：

trans-unit.source: The value attribute contains a DOMString whose value is the current contents of the text editing control being used to enter the password. If the user hasn't entered anything yet, this value is an empty string (""). If the required property is specified, then the password edit box must contain a value other than an empty string to be valid.
trans-unit.target: 该 value 属性包含 DOMString ，其值是文本编辑控件的当前内容被用于输入密码。如果用户尚未输入任何内容，则该值为空字符串（ "" ）。如果指定了 required 属性，则密码编辑框必须包含除空字符串以外的其他值才能生效。

trans-unit.source: The value attribute is a DOMString that contains the current value of the text entered into the text field. You can retrieve this using the HTMLInputElement.value property in JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: 该 value 属性是 DOMString 包含输入到文本字段的当前值。您可以使用JavaScript中的 HTMLInputElement.value 属性来检索此内容。

trans-unit.source: The value attribute is a DOMString that contains the current value of the text entered into the text field. You can retrieve this using the value property in JavaScript.

The value of an <input> element of type "color" is always a DOMString which contains a 7-character string specifying an RGB color in hexadecimal format. While you can input the color in either upper or lower-case, it will be stored in lower-case form. The value is never in any other form, and is never empty.
trans-unit.target: 该 value 的的 <input> 类型的元素 "color" 始终是一个 DOMString 含有7个字符的字符串指定十六进制格式的RGB颜色。您可以以大写或小写形式输入颜色，但颜色将以小写形式存储。该值绝不能采用任何其他形式，并且永远不会为空。

trans-unit.source: The value of an <input> element of type color is always a DOMString which contains a 7-character string specifying an RGB color in hexadecimal format. While you can input the color in either upper- or lower-case, it will be stored in lower-case form. The value is never in any other form, and is never empty.

The width and height attributes are used to specify the width and height the image should be shown at, in pixels. The button is the same size as the image; if you need the button's hit area to be bigger than the image, you will need to use CSS (e.g. padding). Also, if you specify only one dimension, the other is automatically adjusted so that the image maintains its original aspect ratio.
trans-unit.target: 的 width 和 height 属性用来指定的宽度和高度的图像应在被示出，以像素为单位。该按钮的大小与图片相同；如果您需要按钮的点击区域大于图像，则需要使用CSS（例如 padding ）。另外，如果仅指定一个尺寸，则将自动调整另一个尺寸，以使图像保持其原始纵横比。

trans-unit.source: The crossorigin attribute, in combination with an appropriate CORS header, allows images defined by the <img> element to be loaded from foreign origins and used in a <canvas> element as if they were being loaded from the current origin.
trans-unit.target: 的 crossorigin 属性，与适当组合CORS头，允许由定义的图像 <img> 元件从外国的起源被加载并在一个用 <canvas> 元素，好像它们正在从当前原点加载。

trans-unit.source: The activeElement DOM attribute and the hasFocus() DOM method help you track and control a user's interactions with elements on a web page.
trans-unit.target: 该 activeElement DOM属性和 hasFocus() 你跟踪和控制与网页上的元素在用户的交互DOM方法的帮助。

trans-unit.source: The cancel event
trans-unit.target: 在 cancel 事件

trans-unit.source: The change event is received when the color picker's value is finalized. We respond by setting the contents of the <p> element with the ID "output" to a string describing the finally selected color.
trans-unit.target: 该 change 的时候了颜色选择器的值最终确定的接收到的事件。我们通过将ID为 "output" 的 <p> 元素的内容设置为描述最终选择的颜色的字符串来进行响应。

trans-unit.source: The close event
trans-unit.target: 该 close 事件

trans-unit.source: The input event is sent every time the value of the element changes; that is, every time the user adjusts the color in the color picker. Each time this event arrives, we set the box's border color to match the color picker's current value.
trans-unit.target: 的 input 事件被发送每次的元件的值改变; 也就是说，每次用户在颜色选择器中调整颜色时。每次此事件到达时，我们都设置框的边框颜色以匹配拾色器的当前值。

trans-unit.source: The Intl.DateTimeFormat object for formatting dates and times for a given locale

The controlslist attribute, when specified, helps the browser select what controls to show on the media element whenever the browser shows its own set of controls (e.g. when the controls attribute is specified).
The src attribute is empty or null.
trans-unit.target: 在 src 属性为空或 null 。

trans-unit.source: The placeholder attribute lets you specify a text that appears within the <input> element's content area itself when empty. It's intended to be used to show an example input, rather than an explanation or prompt, but tends to be badly misused.
trans-unit.target: 使用 placeholder 属性，您可以指定一个空白的文本，该文本显示在 <input> 元素的内容区域中。它旨在用于显示示例输入，而不是解释或提示，但往往会被严重误用。

trans-unit.source: The placeholder attribute lets you specify text that appears within the <input> element's content area itself when it is empty. The placeholder should never be required in order to understand your forms. It is not a label, and should not be used as a substitute, because it isn't. The placeholder is used to provide a hint as to what an inputted value should look like, not an explanation or prompt.

The scope attribute on header elements is redundant in simple contexts, because scope is inferred. However, some assistive technologies may fail to draw correct inferences, so specifying header scope may improve user experiences. In complex tables, scope can be specified so as to provide necessary information about the cells related to a header.

The <noembed> element is an obsolete, non-standard way to provide alternative, or "fallback", content for browsers that do not support the <embed> element or do not support the type of embedded content an author wishes to use.
trans-unit.target: 所述 <noembed> 元件是过时的，非标准的方式，以提供替代方案，或“回退”，对于不支持的浏览器内容 <embed> 元件或不支持的类型的嵌入内容的作者希望使用。

trans-unit.source: The accesskeyglobal attribute provides a hint for generating a keyboard shortcut for the current element. The attribute value must consist of a single printable character (which includes accented and other characters that can be generated by the keyboard).

The classglobal attribute is a space-separated list of the case-sensitive classes of the element. Classes allow CSS and Javascript to select and access specific elements via the class selectors or functions like the DOM method document.getElementsByClassName.
The contextmenuglobal attribute is the id of a <menu> to use as the contextual menu for this element.
trans-unit.target: 所述 contextmenu 全局属性是ID一个的 <menu> 作为该元素的上下文菜单来使用。

trans-unit.source: The dirglobal attribute is an enumerated attribute that indicates the directionality of the element's text.

The itemidglobal attribute provides microdata in the form of a unique, global identifier of an item. An itemid attribute can only be specified for an element that has both itemscope and itemtype attributes. Also, itemid can only be specified on elements that possess an itemscope attribute whose corresponding itemtype refers to or defines a vocabulary that supports global identifiers.
trans-unit.target: 的 itemid 的全局属性提供的项目的一个独特的，全局标识符的形式微数据。一个 itemid 属性只能为既具有元素指定 itemscope 和 itemtype 属性。同样，只能在拥有 itemscope 属性的元素上指定 itemid ，该元素的相应 itemtype 引用或定义支持全局标识符的词汇表。

trans-unit.source: The spellcheckglobal attribute is an enumerated attribute defines whether the element may be checked for spelling errors.

The styleglobal attribute contains CSS styling declarations to be applied to the element. Note that it is recommended for styles to be defined in a separate file or files. This attribute and the <style> element have mainly the purpose of allowing for quick styling, for example for testing purposes.
The titleglobal attribute contains text representing advisory information related to the element it belongs to.
The CACHE, NETWORK, and FALLBACK sections can be listed in any order in a cache manifest file, and each section can appear more than once in a single manifest.
trans-unit.target: 的 CACHE ， NETWORK ，和 FALLBACK 部分可以在高速缓存中的清单文件任意顺序列出，并且每个部分可以在单一清单中出现多于一次。

trans-unit.source: The FALLBACK: section specifies fallback pages the browser should use if a resource is inaccessible. Each entry in this section lists two URIs—the first is the resource, the second is the fallback. Both URIs must be relative and from the same origin as the manifest file. Wildcards may be used.
trans-unit.target: 在 FALLBACK: 部分指定后备资源是否不可访问的浏览器使用的网页。本节中的每个条目都列出了两个URI，第一个是资源，第二个是后备。这两个URI必须是相对的，并且与清单文件具有相同的来源。可以使用通配符。

trans-unit.source: The NETWORK section of a cache manifest file specifies resources for which a web application requires online access. Network entries in an application cache are essentially an "online whitelist"—URIs specified in the NETWORK section are loaded from the server instead of the cache. This lets the browser's security model protect the user from potential security breaches by limiting access to approved resources.
trans-unit.target: 缓存清单文件的 NETWORK 部分指定Web应用程序需要对其进行联机访问的资源。应用程序缓存中的网络条目本质上是一个“在线白名单”， NETWORK 部分中指定的URI 是从服务器而不是缓存中加载的。通过限制对批准资源的访问，这使浏览器的安全模型可以保护用户免受潜在的安全破坏。

trans-unit.source: The accept attribute doesn't validate the types of the selected files; it simply provides hints for browsers to guide users towards selecting the correct file types. It is still possible (in most cases) for users to toggle an option in the file chooser that makes it possible to override this and select any file they wish, and then choose incorrect file types.
trans-unit.target: 在 accept 属性不验证类型选定的文件;它只是为浏览器提供提示，以引导用户选择正确的文件类型。在大多数情况下，用户仍然有可能在文件选择器中切换一个选项，从而可以覆盖此选项并选择所需的任何文件，然后选择错误的文件类型。

trans-unit.source: The accept attribute takes as its value a comma-separated list of one or more file types, or unique file type specifiers, describing which file types to allow. The accept property is an attribute of the file<input> type. It was supported on the <form> element, but was removed in favor of file in HTML5.

The accept attribute takes as its value a string containing one or more of these unique file type specifiers, separated by commas. For example, a file picker that needs content that can be presented as an image, including both standard image formats and PDF files, might look like this:

trans-unit.source: The align attribute is obsolete; do not use it anymore. Instead, you should use CSS properties or techniques such as CSS Grid or CSS Flexbox to align and position <div> elements on the page.

The allow attribute is used to specify a feature policy for the iframe.
trans-unit.target: 该 allow 属性用于指定功能政策的iframe中。

trans-unit.source: The alt attribute holds a text description of the image, which isn't mandatory but is incredibly useful for accessibility — screen readers read this description out to their users so they know what the image means. Alt text is also displayed on the page if the image can't be loaded for some reason: for example, network errors, content blocking, or linkrot.

The alt attribute provides an alternate string to use as the button's label if the image cannot be shown (due to error, a user agent that cannot or is configured not to show images, or if the user is using a screen reading device). If provided, it must be a non-empty string appropriate as a label for the button.
trans-unit.target: 的 alt 属性提供的替代字符串作为按钮的标签使用，如果该图像不能显示（由于错误，一个用户代理不能或被配置为不显示的图像，或者如果用户正在使用屏幕读取装置）。如果提供的话，它必须是适合用作按钮标签的非空字符串。

trans-unit.source: The auto value doesn’t affect the initial layout viewport, and the whole web page is viewable.
The auto value should be used for data with an unknown directionality, like data coming from user input, eventually stored in a database.
trans-unit.target: 在 auto 价值应当用于数据与未知的方向性，如数据来自用户的输入，最终存储在数据库中来。

trans-unit.source: The autocapitalize attribute doesn’t affect behavior when typing on a physical keyboard. Instead, it affects the behavior of other input mechanisms, such as virtual keyboards on mobile devices and voice input. The behavior of such mechanisms is that they often assist users by automatically capitalizing the first letter of sentences. The autocapitalize attribute enables authors to override that behavior per-element.
trans-unit.target: 当在物理键盘上键入时， autocapitalize 属性不会影响行为。相反，它会影响其他输入机制的行为，例如移动设备上的虚拟键盘和语音输入。这种机制的行为是它们通常通过自动大写句子的首字母来帮助用户。该 autocapitalize 属性使作者能够覆盖每个元素的行为。

trans-unit.source: The autocapitalize attribute never causes autocapitalization to be enabled for an <input> element with a type attribute whose value is url, email, or password.
trans-unit.target: 所述 autocapitalize 属性永远不会导致用于启用autocapitalization <input> 与元素 type 属性，其值是 url ， email ，或 password 。

trans-unit.source: The autocomplete attribute is valid on hidden, text, search, url, tel, email, date, month, week, time, datetime-local, number, range, color, and password. This attribute has no effect on input types that do not return numeric or text data, being valid for all input types except checkbox, radio, file, or any of the button types.
The autofocus attribute cannot be used on inputs of type hidden, since hidden inputs cannot be focused.
The autoplay attribute has precedence over preload. If autoplay is specified, the browser would obviously need to start downloading the audio for playback.
trans-unit.target: 该 autoplay 属性拥有优先 preload 。如果指定了 autoplay ，则浏览器显然需要开始下载音频以进行播放。

trans-unit.source: The capture attribute specifies that, optionally, a new file should be captured, and which device should be used to capture that new media of a type defined by the accept attribute. Values include user and environment. The capture attribute is supported on the file input type.

The capture attribute takes as it's value a string that specifies which camera to use for capture of image or video data, if the accept attribute indicates that the input should be of one of those types.
The contain value means that the viewport is scaled to fit the largest rectangle inscribed within the display.
The contenteditableglobal attribute is an enumerated attribute indicating if the element should be editable by the user. If so, the browser modifies its widget to allow editing.
trans-unit.target: 所述 contenteditable 全局属性是指示如果元素应该是可由用户编辑枚举属性。如果是这样，浏览器将修改其小部件以允许编辑。

trans-unit.source: The coords attribute details the coordinates of the shape attribute in size, shape, and placement of an <area>.

The cover value means that the viewport is scaled to fill the device display. It is highly recommended to make use of the safe area inset variables to ensure that important content doesn't end up outside the display.
The crossorigin attribute was implemented in WebKit in WebKit bug 81438.

The crossorigin content attribute on media elements is a CORS settings attribute.
The data-*global attributes form a class of attributes called custom data attributes, that allow proprietary information to be exchanged between the HTML and its DOM representation by scripts.
The defer attribute has no effect on module scripts — they defer by default.
The disabled attribute is supported by <button>, <command>, <fieldset>, <keygen>, <optgroup>, <option>, <select>, <textarea> and <input>.

The dns-prefetch keyword for the rel attribute of the <link> element is a hint to browsers that the user is likely to need resources from the target resource's origin, and therefore the browser can likely improve the user experience by preemptively performing DNS resolution for that origin.
The dropzoneglobal attribute is an enumerated attribute indicating what types of content can be dropped on an element, using the HTML Drag and Drop API. It can have the following values:

The duration attribute has been updated.
The form attribute lets you place an input anywhere in the document but have it included with a form elsewhere in the document.
trans-unit.target: 通过 form 属性，您可以将输入放置在文档中的任何位置，但将其包含在文档中其他位置的表单中。

trans-unit.source: The geo microformat represents a physical location on the planet Earth using latitude and longitude coordinates.

trans-unit.source: The h-event is for events on the web. h-event is often used with both event listings and individual event pages
The hCalendar microformat represents an appointment or other event on a calendar.
trans-unit.target: 该 hCalendar 微格式表示日历上的约定或其它事件。

trans-unit.source: The hCard microformat describes an entry in a contact database, as a virtual business card.
trans-unit.target: 在 hCard 微格式描述在联系人数据库中的条目，作为一个虚拟的名片。

trans-unit.source: The hidden attribute must not be used to hide content just from one presentation. If something is marked hidden, it is hidden from all presentations, including, for instance, screen readers.

The hidden attribute must not be used to hide content that could legitimately be shown in another presentation. For example, it is incorrect to use hidden to hide panels in a tabbed dialog, because the tabbed interface is merely a kind of overflow presentation — one could equally well just show all the form controls in one big page with a scrollbar. It is similarly incorrect to use this attribute to hide content just from one presentation — if something is marked hidden, it is hidden from all presentations, including, for instance, screen readers.
trans-unit.target: 该 hidden 属性不能用于可能会在合法另一个演示显示隐藏的内容。例如，在选项卡式对话框中使用“ hidden 来隐藏面板是不正确的，因为选项卡式界面只是一种溢出演示文稿—同样，也可以只在一个大页面中用滚动条显示所有表单控件。同样，使用此属性仅隐藏一个演示文稿中的内容也是不正确的-如果某些内容被标记为隐藏，则它对于所有演示文稿（包括屏幕阅读器）都是隐藏的。

trans-unit.source: The hiddenglobal attribute is a Boolean attribute indicating that the element is not yet, or is no longer, relevant. For example, it can be used to hide elements of the page that can't be used until the login process has been completed. Browsers won't render elements with the hidden attribute set.
trans-unit.target: 该 hidden 全局属性是表示该元素还没有，或者是不再，布尔属性相关。例如，它可以用于隐藏在登录过程完成之前无法使用的页面元素。浏览器不会渲染具有 hidden 属性集的元素。

trans-unit.source: The id of the <datalist> element that contains the optional pre-defined autocomplete options
The inputmodeglobal attribute is an enumerated attribute that hints at the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents. It can have the following values:

The inputmodeglobal attribute is an enumerated attribute that provides a hint as to the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents. It can have the following values:

trans-unit.source: The isglobal attribute allows you to specify that a standard HTML element should behave like a defined custom built-in element (see Using custom elements for more details).
trans-unit.target: 该 is 全局属性允许你指定一个标准的HTML元素应该表现得像内置元素的定义的自定义（请参阅使用自定义元素有详细介绍）。

trans-unit.source: The itempropglobal attribute is used to add properties to an item. Every HTML element can have an itemprop attribute specified, and an itemprop consists of a name-value pair. Each name-value pair is called a property, and a group of one or more properties forms an item. Property values are either a string or a URL and can be associated with a very wide range of elements including <audio>, <embed>, <iframe>, <img>, <link>, <object>, <source> , <track>, and <video>.
trans-unit.target: 该 itemprop 全局属性用来属性添加到项目中。每个HTML元素都可以指定一个 itemprop 属性，并且 itemprop 由一个名称/值对组成。每个名称/值对称为一个属性，一组一个或多个属性构成一个item。属性值可以是字符串，也可以是URL，并且可以与包括 <audio> ， <embed> ， <iframe> ， <img> ， <link> ， <object> ， <source> ， <track> 和 <video> 。

trans-unit.source: The itemref attribute can only be specified on elements that have an itemscope attribute specified.
trans-unit.target: 所述 itemref 属性只能在具有元素指定 itemscope 指定的属性。

trans-unit.source: The keytype parameter is used to specify what type of key is to be generated. Valid values are "RSA", which is the default, "DSA" and "EC". The name and challenge attributes are required in all cases. The keytype attribute is optional for RSA key generation and required for DSA and EC key generation. The keyparams attribute is required for DSA and EC key generation and ignored for RSA key generation. PQG is a synonym for keyparams. That is, you may specify keyparams="pqg-params" or pqg="pqg-params".
trans-unit.target: 该 keytype 参数用于指定键的类型是要生成的内容。有效值为“ RSA ”，这是默认值，“ DSA ”和“ EC ”。在所有情况下， name 和 challenge 属性都是必需的。该 keytype 的属性是可选的RSA密钥生成和DSA和EC密钥生成必需的。对于DSA和EC密钥生成， keyparams 属性是必需的，而对于RSA密钥生成，则忽略该属性。 PQG 是一个代名词 keyparams 。也就是说，您可以指定 keyparams="pqg-params" 或 pqg="pqg-params" 。

trans-unit.source: The langglobal attribute helps define the language of an element: the language that non-editable elements are written in, or the language that the editable elements should be written in by the user. The attribute contains a single “language tag” in the format defined in Tags for Identifying Languages (BCP47).
trans-unit.target: 在 lang 全局属性可以帮助定义元素的语言：是不可编辑的元素都写在语言，或可编辑元素应该由用户写入的语言。该属性包含一个“语言标签”，格式为“识别语言的标签（BCP47） ”中定义的格式。

trans-unit.source: The list attribute is not supported by the hidden, password, checkbox, radio, file, or any of the button types.
trans-unit.target: 该 list 属性不被支持的 hidden ， password ， checkbox ， radio ， file ，或任何按钮类型。

trans-unit.source: The main role is applied to <main> by default, and the presentation role is permitted as well.
trans-unit.target: 的 main 作用是施加到 <main> 默认，并且 presentation 角色被允许为好。

trans-unit.source: The manifest attribute in a web application can specify either the relative path of a cache manifest file or an absolute URL. (Absolute URLs must be from the same origin as the application). A cache manifest file can have any file extension, but it must be served with the MIME type text/cache-manifest.
trans-unit.target: Web应用程序中的 manifest 属性可以指定缓存清单文件的相对路径或绝对URL。（绝对URL必须与应用程序来自同一来源）。缓存清单文件可以具有任何文件扩展名，但必须与MIME类型 text/cache-manifest 一起提供。

trans-unit.source: The manifest attribute references a URL for a cache manifest file: a text file that lists URLs that browsers should cache for your application.
The manifest keyword for the rel attribute of the <link> element indicates that the target resource is a Web app manifest.

The max attribute defines the maximum value that is acceptable and valid for the input containing the attribute. If the value of the element is greater than this, the element fails constraint validation. This value must be greater than or equal to the value of the min attribute. If the max attribute is present by is not specified or is invalid, no max value is applied. If the max attribute is valid and a non-empty value is greater than the maximum allowed by the max attribute, constraint validation will prevent form submission.

The maxlength attribute defines the maximum number of characters (as UTF-16 code units) the user can enter into an <input> or <textarea>. This must be an integer value 0 or higher. If no maxlength is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the input or textarea has no maximum length.
The media attribute
trans-unit.target: 该 media 属性

trans-unit.source: The media attribute specifies a media condition (similar to a media query) that the user agent will evaluate for each <source> element.

The media attribute specifies a media condition (similar to a media query) that the user agent will evaluate for each <source> element. If the media condition evaluates to false, its <source> element is skipped.
trans-unit.target: 所述 media 属性指定媒体条件（类似于媒体查询），所述用户代理将对于每个评估 <source> 元素。如果媒体条件评估为 false ，则将跳过其 <source> 元素。

trans-unit.source: The min attribute defines the minimum value that is acceptable and valid for the input containing the attribute. If the value of the element is less than this, the element fails constraint validation. This value must be less than or equal to the value of the max attribute. If a value is specified for min that isn't a valid number, the input has no minimum value.

The minlength attribute defines the minimum number of characters (as UTF-16 code units) the user can enter into an <input> or <textarea>. This must be an integer value 0 or higher. If no minlength is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the input has no minimum length. This value must be less than or equal to the value of maxlength, otherwise the value will never be valid, as it is impossible to meet both criteria.

The modulepreload keyword for the rel attribute of the <link> element provides a declarative way to preemptively fetch a module script and its dependencies, and store them in the document's module map for later evaluation.

The multiple attribute on the <select> element represents a control for selecting zero or more options from the list of options. Otherwise, the <select> element represents a control for selecting a single <option> from the list of options.

The multiple attribute on the <select> element represents a control for selecting zero or more options from the list of options. Otherwise, the <select> element represents a control for selecting a single <option> from the list of options. The control generally has a different appearance based on the presence of the multiple attribute, with most browsers displaying a scrolling list box instead of a single line dropdown when the attribute is present.
The n property is normally required, but since Mozilla's implementation offers an implied n optimization, it is optional, and will be parsed from the fn property if not specifically provided.
trans-unit.target: 该 n 属性通常是必需的，但由于Mozilla的实现提供了一个隐含的 n 优化，它是可选的，并会从解析 fn 财产，如果没有特别规定。

trans-unit.source: The name and content attributes can be used together to provide document metadata in terms of name-value pairs, with the name attribute giving the metadata name, and the content attribute giving the value.

The name attribute gives the map a name so that it can be referenced. The attribute must be present and must have a non-empty value with no space characters. The value of the name attribute must not be a compatibility-caseless match for the value of the name attribute of another <map> element in the same document. If the id attribute is also specified, both attributes must have the same value.
The new-password value.

The noopener keyword for the rel attribute of the <a>, <area>, and <form> elements instructs the browser to navigate to the target resource without granting the new browsing context access to the document that opened it — by not setting the Window.opener property on the opened window (it returns null).

The noreferrer keyword for the rel attribute of the <a>, <area>, and <form> elements instructs the browser, when navigating to the target resource, to omit the Referer header and otherwise leak no referrer information — and additionally to behave as if the noopener keyword were also specified.
The partglobal attribute contains a space-separated list of the part names of the element. Part names allows CSS to select and style specific elements in a shadow tree via the ::part pseudo-element.
The pattern attribute is an attribute of the text, tel, email, url, password, and search input types.

The pattern attribute specifies a regular expression the form control's value should match. If a non-null value doesn't conform to the constraints set by the pattern value, the ValidityState object's read-only patternMismatch property will be true.

The pattern attribute, when specified, is a regular expression that the input's value must match in order for the value to pass constraint validation. It must be a valid JavaScript regular expression, as used by the RegExp type, and as documented in our guide on regular expressions; the 'u' flag is specified when compiling the regular expression, so that the pattern is treated as a sequence of Unicode code points, instead of as ASCII. No forward slashes should be specified around the pattern text.
trans-unit.target: 的 pattern 属性，指定时，是一个正则表达式的输入的 value 必须为使值相匹配来传递约束验证。它必须是有效的JavaScript正则表达式，由 RegExp 类型使用，并且在我们的正则表达式指南中有说明；在编译正则表达式时指定了 'u' 标志，因此该模式被视为Unicode代码点的序列，而不是ASCII。模式文字周围不能指定正斜杠。

trans-unit.source: The pattern attribute, when specified, is a regular expression that the input's value must match in order for the value to pass constraint validation. It must be a valid JavaScript regular expression, as used by the RegExp type, and as documented in our guide on regular expressions; the 'u' flag is specified when compiling the regular expression, so that the pattern is treated as a sequence of Unicode code points, instead of as ASCII. No forward slashes should be specified around the pattern text.

The pattern attribute, when specified, is a regular expression which the input's value must match in order for the value to pass constraint validation. It must be a valid JavaScript regular expression, as used by the RegExp type, and as documented in our guide on regular expressions; the 'u' flag is specified when compiling the regular expression, so that the pattern is treated as a sequence of Unicode code points, instead of as ASCII. No forward slashes should be specified around the pattern text.
The ping attribute specifies a space-separated list of URLs to be notified if a user follows the hyperlink.

The placeholder attribute is a string that provides a brief hint to the user as to what kind of information is expected in the field. It should be a word or short phrase that demonstrates the expected type of data, rather than an explanatory message. The text must not include carriage returns or line feeds.
trans-unit.target: 该 placeholder 属性是提供了一个简短的提示给用户，以什么样的信息在油田预计的字符串。它应该是一个单词或短语来说明预期的数据类型，而不是说明性消息。文字不得包含回车符或换行符。

trans-unit.source: The placeholder attribute is a string that provides a brief hint to the user as to what kind of information is expected in the field. It should be a word or short phrase that provides a hint as to the expected type of data, rather than an explanation or prompt. The text must not include carriage returns or line feeds. So for example if a field is expected to capture a user's first name, and its label is "First Name", a suitable placeholder might be "e.g. Mustafa".

The preconnect keyword for the rel attribute of the <link> element is a hint to browsers that the user is likely to need resources from the target resource's origin, and therefore the browser can likely improve the user experience by preemptively initiating a connection to that origin.

The prefetch keyword for the rel attribute of the <link> element is a hint to browsers that the user is likely to need the target resource for future navigations, and therefore the browser can likely improve the user experience by preemptively fetching and caching the resource.

The preload keyword for the rel attribute of the <link> element indicates the user is highly likely to require the target resource for the current navigation, and therefore the browser must preemptively fetch and cache the resource.

The preload value of the <link> element's rel attribute allows you to write declarative fetch requests in your HTML <head>, specifying resources that your pages will need very soon after loading, which you therefore want to start preloading early in the lifecycle of a page load, before the browser's main rendering machinery kicks in. This ensures that they are made available earlier and are less likely to block the page's first render, leading to performance improvements. This article provides a basic guide to how preload works.
trans-unit.target: <link> 元素的 rel 属性的 preload 值使您可以在HTML <head> 中编写声明性的获取请求，指定页面加载后不久将需要的资源，因此，您希望在HTML 的生命周期中尽早开始预加载页面加载，而不是启动浏览器的主要渲染机制。这确保了它们较早可用，并且不太可能阻塞页面的第一次渲染，从而提高了性能。本文提供了有关 preload 如何工作的基本指南。

trans-unit.source: The preload value of the <link> element's rel attribute lets you declare fetch requests in the HTML's <head>, specifying resources that your page will need very soon, which you want to start loading early in the page lifecycle, before browsers' main rendering machinery kicks in. This ensures they are available earlier and are less likely to block the page's render, improving performance.

The prerender keyword for the rel attribute of the <link> element is a hint to browsers that the user might need the target resource for the next navigation, and therefore the browser can likely improve the user experience by preemptively fetching and processing the resource — for example, by fetching its subresources or performing some rendering in the background offscreen.

The readonly attribute is supported by text, search, url, tel, email, password, date, month, week, time, datetime-local, and number<input> types and the <textarea> form control elements. If present on any of these input types and elements, the :read-only pseudo class will match. If the attribute is not included, the :read-write pseudo class will match.
The referrer value wasn't taken into account when navigation was happening via the context menu or middle click until Firefox 39.

The rel attribute defines the relationship between a linked resource and the current document. Valid on <link>, <a>, <area>, and <form>, the supported values depend on the element on which the attribute is found.

The rel attribute has no default value. If the attribute is omitted or if none of the values in the attribute are supported, then the document has no particular relationship with the destination resource other than there being a hyperlink between the two. In this case, on <link> and <form>, if the rel attribute is absent, has no keywords, or if not one or more of the space-separated keywords above, then the element does not create any links. <a> and <area> will still created links, but without a defined relationship.

The rel attribute is relevant to the <link>, <a>, <area>, and <form> elements, but some values only relevant to a subset of those elements. Like all HTML keyword attribute values, these values are case-insenstive.
The resize CSS property doesn't have any effect on this element due to bug 680823.
trans-unit.target: 由于bug 680823， resize CSS属性对该元素没有任何影响。

trans-unit.source: The results attribute—supported only by Safari—is a numeric value that lets you override the maximum number of entries to be displayed in the <input> element's natively-provided drop-down menu of previous search queries.

trans-unit.source: The rows and cols attributes allow you to specify an exact size for the <textarea> to take. Setting these is a good idea for consistency, as browser defaults can differ.

trans-unit.source: The size attribute causes only 4 lines to display at a time; you can scroll to view all the options.

trans-unit.source: The size attribute defines the width of the <input> and the height of the <select> element. For the input, if the type attribute is text or password then it's the number of characters. This must be an integer value 0 or higher. If no size is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the input has no size declared, and the form control will be the default width based on the user agent. If CSS targets the element with properties impacting the width, CSS takes precedence.
The size attribute has no impact on constraint validation.

The size attribute is a numeric value indicating how many characters wide the input field should be. The value must be a number greater than zero, and the default value is 20. Since character widths vary, this may or may not be exact and should not be relied upon to be so; the resulting input may be narrower or wider than the specified number of characters, depending on the characters and the font (font settings in use).
trans-unit.target: 的 size 属性是表示输入字段应多少个字符宽是数值。该值必须是一个大于零的数字，默认值是20。由于字符宽度各不相同，因此这可能是正确的，也可能是不正确的，因此不应该这样。根据字符和字体（使用的 font 设置），结果输入可能比指定的字符数窄或宽。

trans-unit.source: The size attribute is a numeric value indicating how many characters wide the input field should be. The value must be a number greater than zero, and the default value is 20. Since character widths vary, this may or may not be exact and should not be relied upon to be so; the resulting input may be narrower or wider than the specified number of characters, depending on the characters and the font (font settings in use.

trans-unit.source: The size is separate from the length limitation on the entered URL itself. You can specify a minimum length, in characters, for the entered URL using the minlength attribute; similarly, use maxlength to set the maximum length of the entered URL. If maxLength exceeds size, the input box's contents will scroll as needed to show the current selection or insertion point as the content is manipulated.
trans-unit.target: 的 size 是从所输入的URL本身长度不限分开。您可以使用 minlength 属性为输入的URL指定最小长度（以字符为单位）。同样，使用 maxlength 设置输入URL的最大长度。如果 maxLength 超过 size ，则输入框的内容将根据需要滚动，以显示当前选择或插入点。

trans-unit.source: The size is separate from the length limitation on the entered telephone number. You can specify a minimum length, in characters, for the entered telephone number using the minlength attribute; similarly, use maxlength to set the maximum length of the entered telephone number.
trans-unit.target: 的 size 是从所输入的电话号码的长度的限制分开。您可以使用 minlength 属性为输入的电话号码指定最小长度（以字符为单位）。同样，使用 maxlength 设置输入的电话号码的最大长度。

trans-unit.source: The step attribute is a number that specifies the granularity that the value must adhere to or the keyword any. It is valid for the numeric input types, including the date, month, week, time, datetime-local, number and range types.

The step attribute is a number that specifies the granularity that the value must adhere to, or the special value "any", which is described below. Only values which are equal to the basis for stepping (min if specified, value otherwise, and an appropriate default value if neither of those is provided) are valid.
trans-unit.target: 的 step 的属性是一个数字，它指定粒度该值必须坚持，或特殊值 "any" ，这将在下面描述。仅等于步进基础的 value （如果指定，则为 min ，否则为值，如果未提供则为适当的默认值）。

trans-unit.source: The step attribute is a number that specifies the granularity that the value must adhere to, or the special value any, which is described below. Only values which are equal to the basis for stepping (min if specified, value otherwise, and an appropriate default value if neither of those is provided) are valid.

The step sets the stepping interval when clicking up and down spinner buttons, moving a slider left and right on a range, and validating the different date types. If not explicitly included, step defaults to 1 for number and range, and 1 unit type (minute, week, month, day) for the date/time input types. The value can must be a positive number - integer or float -- or the special value any, which means no stepping is implied, and any value is allowed (barring other constraints, such as min and max).

trans-unit.source: The value attribute is one which all <input>s share; however, it serves a special purpose for inputs of type checkbox: when a form is submitted, only checkboxes which are currently checked are submitted to the server, and the reported value is the value of the value attribute. If the value is not otherwise specified, it is the string on by default. This is demonstrated in the section Value above.

The value attribute is one which all <input>s share; however, it serves a special purpose for inputs of type radio: when a form is submitted, only radio buttons which are currently checked are submitted to the server, and the reported value is the value of the value attribute. If the value is not otherwise specified, it is the string on by default. This is demonstrated in the section Value above.

The value attribute is one which all inputs share; however, it serves a special purpose for inputs of type checkbox: when a form is submitted, only checkboxes which are currently checked are submitted to the server, and the reported value is the value of the value attribute. If the value is not otherwise specified, it is the string "on" by default. This is demonstrated in the section Value above.

trans-unit.source: The value of the time input is always in 24-hour format that includes leading zeros: hh:mm, regardless of the input format, which is likely to be selected based on the user's locale (or by the user agent). If the time includes seconds (see Using the step attribute), the format is always hh:mm:ss. You can learn more about the format of the time value used by this input type in Time strings in Date and time formats used in HTML.

The value of the time input is always in 24-hour format: "hh:mm", regardless of the input format, which is likely to be selected based on the user's locale (or by the user agent). If the time includes seconds (see Using the step attribute), the format is always "hh:mm:ss".
trans-unit.target: 该 value 的的 time 输入总是在24小时格式： "hh:mm" ，无论输入格式，这是可能选择根据用户的语言环境（或由用户代理）的。如果时间包括秒（请参阅使用step属性），则格式始终为 "hh:mm:ss" 。

The id global attribute defines an identifier (ID) which must be unique in the whole document. Its purpose is to identify the element when linking (using a fragment identifier), scripting, or styling (with CSS).
The HTML <h1>–<h6> elements represent six levels of section headings. <h1> is the highest section level and <h6> is the lowest.
trans-unit.target: 的HTML <h1> - <h6> 元素代表六个级别部分的标题的。 <h1> 是最高的部分级别，而 <h6> 是最低的部分级别。

trans-unit.target: 的HTML双向文本覆盖元件（ <bdo> ）覆盖文本的当前方向性，以便在文本中在不同方向上被渲染。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Bring Attention To element (<b>) is used to draw the reader's attention to the element's contents, which are not otherwise granted special importance. This was formerly known as the Boldface element, and most browsers still draw the text in boldface. However, you should not use <b> for styling text; instead, you should use the CSS font-weight property to create boldface text, or the <strong> element to indicate that text is of special importance.
trans-unit.target: 在使人们关注HTML元素（ <b> ）来吸引读者的注意力吸引到元素的内容，这是不以其他方式给予特殊的重要性。这以前称为Boldface元素，大多数浏览器仍以粗体显示文本。但是，您不应使用 <b> 设置文字样式。相反，您应该使用CSS font-weight 属性创建粗体文本，或者使用 <strong> 元素指示文本特别重要。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Citation element (<cite>) is used to describe a reference to a cited creative work, and must include either the title or author or the URL of that work.

trans-unit.source: The HTML Content Division element (<div>) is the generic container for flow content. It has no effect on the content or layout until styled using CSS.

trans-unit.source: The HTML Definition element (<dfn>) is used to indicate the term being defined within the context of a definition phrase or sentence.

trans-unit.source: The HTML Disclosure Summary element (<summary>) element specifies a summary, caption, or legend for a <details> element's disclosure box. Clicking the <summary> element toggles the state of the parent <details> element open and closed.

trans-unit.source: The HTML Keyboard Input element (<kbd>) represents a span of inline text denoting textual user input from a keyboard, voice input, or any other text entry device.
trans-unit.target: 的HTML键盘输入元件（ <kbd> ）表示嵌入式文本从一个键盘，语音输入，或任何其他文本输入设备，表示文本的用户输入的跨度。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Keyboard Input element (<kbd>) represents a span of inline text denoting textual user input from a keyboard, voice input, or any other text entry device. By convention, the user agent defaults to rendering the contents of a <kbd> element using its default monospace font, although this is not mandated by the HTML standard.
trans-unit.target: 的HTML键盘输入元件（ <kbd> ）表示嵌入式文本从一个键盘，语音输入，或任何其他文本输入设备，表示文本的用户输入的跨度。按照约定，用户代理默认使用其默认的等宽字体来呈现 <kbd> 元素的内容，尽管HTML标准没有对此要求。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Mark Text element (<mark>) represents text which is marked or highlighted for reference or notation purposes, due to the marked passage's relevance or importance in the enclosing context.
trans-unit.target: 在HTML标记文本元素（ <mark> ）表示被文字标记或突出显示以供参考或符号的目的，由于标记的通道在封闭的情况下的相关性或重要性。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Multi-Column Layout element (<multicol>) was an experimental element designed to allow multi-column layouts and must not be used.
trans-unit.target: 的HTML多列布局元件（ <multicol> ）被设计为允许多列布局的实验元件，并且必须不被使用。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Output element (<output>) is a container element into which a site or app can inject the results of a calculation or the outcome of a user action.
trans-unit.target: 的HTML输出元件（ <output> ）是在其中一个网站或应用可以注入一个计算或用户动作的结果的结果的容器元素。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Sample Element (<samp>) is used to enclose inline text which represents sample (or quoted) output from a computer program.
trans-unit.target: 的HTML样本单元（ <samp> ）用于包围从一个计算机程序，其表示样品嵌入式文本（或引用）的输出。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Sample Element (<samp>) is used to enclose inline text which represents sample (or quoted) output from a computer program. Its contents are typically rendered using the browser's default monospaced font (such as Courier or Lucida Console).
trans-unit.target: 的HTML样本单元（ <samp> ）用于包围从一个计算机程序，其表示样品嵌入式文本（或引用）的输出。它的内容通常使用浏览器的默认等宽字体（例如Courier或Lucida Console）呈现。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Subscript element (<sub>) specifies inline text which should be displayed as subscript for solely typographical reasons.
trans-unit.target: 的HTML标元素（ <sub> ）指明应当被显示为下标仅用于印刷原因嵌入式文本。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Subscript element (<sub>) specifies inline text which should be displayed as subscript for solely typographical reasons. Subscripts are typically rendered with a lowered baseline using smaller text.
trans-unit.target: 的HTML标元素（ <sub> ）指明应当被显示为下标仅用于印刷原因嵌入式文本。下标通常使用较小的文本以较低的基线呈现。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Superscript element (<sup>) specifies inline text which is to be displayed as superscript for solely typographical reasons.
trans-unit.target: 的HTML标元素（ <sup> ）指定嵌入式文本将被显示为上标仅用于印刷的原因。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Superscript element (<sup>) specifies inline text which is to be displayed as superscript for solely typographical reasons. Superscripts are usually rendered with a raised baseline using smaller text.
trans-unit.target: 的HTML标元素（ <sup> ）指定嵌入式文本将被显示为上标仅用于印刷的原因。上标通常使用较小的文本以升高的基线进行渲染。

trans-unit.source: The HTML Table Body element (<tbody>) encapsulates a set of table row (<tr> elements), indicating that they comprise the body of the table (<table>).
